about: The College of Engineering Chengannur (CEC), was established by the Government of Kerala under the aegis of the IHRD, in the year 1993. It has been approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) and affiliated to APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University (KTU). Ever since its inception, the college has maintained its eminence as a leading engineering college in Kerala. Being located in Chengannur town, Alleppey district the college has got access to all means of transport, communication and lodging facilities.

events.head: Summer Internship Program
events.para: The 5-day internship program at the College of Engineering Chengannur! This program is designed to inspire and motivate higher secondary students to pursue novel ideas and explore technological possibilities outside the scope of their usual academic curriculum through project-based learning.

events.head: IHRD THARANG
events.para: IHRD Tharang’23, the first National Level Techno-Cultural-Entrepreneurial event organized by the Institute of Human Resources Development (IHRD). Adhering to the theme YOUTH, SCIENCE and LEADERSHIP, IHRD Tharang’23 aims at providing a holistic experience to the students and empower them in building ideas to design models and finished products in technology, cultural and entrepreneurship domains. The tech fest will be held in College of Engineering, Chengannur on February 3rd , 4th , 5th 2023 and job fair on 6th of February.

events.head: SPANDANAM
events.para: APJAKTU NSS CELL Units 184, 338, 559 & 628 of College of Engineering Chengannur successfully conducted SPANDANAM – a blood donation camp. Over 60 volunteers participated in this noble cause.

events.head: SIGHT Gramina Digital Hub
events.para: SIGHT Gramina Digital Hub is an IEEE SIGHT/HAC Funded Project with a project funding of $4000 in which a digital hub was successfully set up in Kulanada Grama Panchyat.

events.head: MAKER STATION
events.para: The Maker Station, an innovative and exciting program organized by Tinkerhub Foundation in partnership with Amazon India, which is an iteration of our popular program, Learning Stations.
